0		ALL		" Ayushman Bharat
column2: a flagship scheme of Government of India
column3: was launched as recommended by the National Health Policy 2017
column4: to achieve the vision of Universal Health Coverage (UHC).This initiative has been designed to meet Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and its underlining commitment
column5: which is to ""leave no one behind.""

column1: Ayushman Bharat is an attempt to move from sectoral and segmented approach of health service delivery to a comprehensive need-based health care service. This scheme aims to undertake path breaking interventions to holistically address the healthcare system (covering prevention
column2: promotion and ambulatory care) at the primary
column3: secondary and tertiary level. Ayushman Bharat adopts a continuum of care approach
column4: comprising of two inter-related components

column1: Health and Wellness Centres (HWCs)
Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
"	CENTRAL		Ayushman Bharat Health Scheme	ALL
1		ALL		" In February 2018
column2: the Government of India announced the creation of 1
column4: 000 Health and Wellness Centres (HWCs) by transforming the existing Sub Centres and Primary Health Centres. These centres are to deliver Comprehensive Primary Health Care (CPHC) bringing healthcare closer to the homes of people. They cover both
column5: maternal and child health services and non-communicable diseases
column6: including free essential drugs and diagnostic services.

column1: Health and Wellness Centers are envisaged to deliver an expanded range of services to address the primary health care needs of the entire population in their area
column2: expanding access
column3: universality and equity close to the community. The emphasis of health promotion and prevention is designed to bring focus on keeping people healthy by engaging and empowering individuals and communities to choose healthy behaviours and make changes that reduce the risk of developing chronic diseases and morbidities."	CENTRAL		Health and Wellness Centers (HWCs)	ALL

column1: 2	 Benefit cover under various Government-funded health insurance schemes in India have always been structured on an upper ceiling limit ranging from an annual cover of INR30
column2: 000 to INR3
column4: 000 per family across various States which created a fragmented system.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    PM-JAY provides cashless cover of up to INR5
column6: 000 to each eligible family per annum for listed secondary and tertiary care conditions.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The cover under the scheme includes all expenses incurred on the following components of the treatment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           The benefits of INR 5
column8: 000 are on a family floater basis which means that it can be used by one or all members of the family. The RSBY had a family cap of five members.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         However
column9: based on learnings from those schemes
column10: PM-JAY has been designed in such a way that there is no cap on family size or age of members. In addition
column11: pre-existing diseases are covered from the very first day.	ALL		  PM-JAY is the world’s largest health insurance/ assurance scheme fully financed by the government.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        It provides a cover of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization across public and private empanelled hospitals in India.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Over 10.74 crore poor and vulnerable entitled families (approximately 50 crore beneficiaries) are eligible for these benefits.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          PM-JAY provides cashless access to health care services for the beneficiary at the point of service
column13: the hospital.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 PM-JAY envisions to help mitigate catastrophic expenditure on medical treatment which pushes nearly 6 crore Indians into poverty each year.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              It covers up to 3 days of pre-hospitalization and 15 days post-hospitalization expenses such as diagnostics and medicines.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         There is no restriction on the family size
column14: age or gender.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               All pre–existing conditions are covered from day one.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Benefits of the scheme are portable across the country i.e. a beneficiary can visit any empanelled public or private hospital in India to avail cashless treatment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Services include approximately 1
column15: 393 procedures covering all the costs related to treatment
column16: including but not limited to drugs
column22: OT and ICU charges etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Public hospitals are reimbursed for the healthcare services at par with the private hospitals.	CENTRAL	" The second component under Ayushman Bharat is the Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojna or PM-JAY as it is popularly known. This scheme was launched on 23rd September
column24: Jharkhand by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India

column1: Ayushman Bharat PM-JAY is the largest health assurance scheme in the world which aims at providing a health cover of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to over 10.74 crores poor and vulnerable families (approximately 50 crore beneficiaries) that form the bottom 40% of the Indian population.
The households included are based on the deprivation and occupational criteria of Socio-Economic Caste Census 2011 (SECC 2011) for rural and urban areas respectively.
PM-JAY was earlier known as the National Health Protection Scheme (NHPS) before being rechristened.
It subsumed the then existing Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) which had been launched in 2008.
The coverage mentioned under PM-JAY
column2: therefore
column3: also includes families that were covered in RSBY but are not present in the SECC 2011 database.

column1: PM-JAY is fully funded by the Government and cost of implementation is shared between the Central and State Governments."	Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)	ALL

column1: 4		ALL	People aged 18 to 70 and having a bank account can avail of the benefits of this scheme. This policy offers an annual cover of Rs. 1 lakh for partial disability and Rs. 2 lakhs for total disability/death for a premium of Rs. 12. The premium gets debited automatically from the insured person’s bank account.	This scheme came into existence to offer accident insurance to the people of India. In 2016
column2: it was observed that only 20% of the Indian citizens had an insurance cover. However
column3: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana aspires to change this statistic in a positive manner.	CENTRAL		Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana	ALL

column1: 5	Sum Insured:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        One can claim up to Rs. 30000 for various expenses that are covered under the policy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Coverage For The Family:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      A typical Indian family of five members can benefit from this plan. The head of the family
column2: spouse and three dependents are covered under the plan. A newborn baby can become an additional beneficiary until the expiry of the policy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              No Waiting Period:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             A waiting period is a time when a policyholder cannot make a claim against certain conditions as specified by the insurance company. One needs to bear the cost of treatment from their own pocket during the waiting period. However
column3: the RSBY does not have any such clause.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Pre-existing Diseases:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        As the name suggests
column4: a pre-existing disease is any ailment suffered by the policyholder or the beneficiaries before purchasing the policy. This includes the diseases that the policyholder may not be aware of when purchasing the policy.Usually
column5: in health insurance policies a waiting period of 2 to 4 years is imposed on pre-existing diseases. However
column6: these are covered under RSBY irrespective of the age of a beneficiary from the date of purchase.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Under RSBY
column7: the government has fixed the hospitalization cover limit at Rs. 30
column8: 000. The government has also fixed the hospital package rates.	ALL	Beneficiary Criteria: The beneficiary should belong either to a BPL (Below Poverty Line) household; Or Should be workers belonging to unorganized categories such as construction and building workers who are registered under Welfare Boards
column17: Rickshaw pullers and Taxi/ Auto drivers.                                                                   Age Limit: No age limit.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               Number of family members covered: A family unit of up to 5 members are covered under this scheme.Pre-existing illnesses are also covered without any age limit criterion. 5 family members including self
column19: and spouse can be covered.  The registration fee for the recipients is only 30 rupees and the premium is paid by the government to the insurance company.	"Ministry of Labour & Employment
column20: Government of India launched this National Health Insurance Scheme for families who are below the poverty line. The aim is to offer health insurance coverage to BPL families in an economical manner.

column1: Health Coverage:
A health covers of up to Rs. 30
column2: 000/- is provided per year for up to 5 members of the family on a family floater basis. This also includes pre-existing conditions right from the first day itself.

column1: Biometric Smart Card:

A biometric Smart Card is provided to the insured person. This contains the applicants fingerprints as well as other details in its chip. The insured person only needs to provide this smart card at the time of the claim to the hospital.
RSBY is completely paperless and cashless:
All the required documents are submitted to the insurer electronically
column2: making the process completely paperless. Also
column3: the claimant only has to produce the cashless smart card to the hospital. Thus the hassle of paying in cash and waiting for reimbursement later is completely avoided."	CENTRAL		RASHTRIYA SWASTHA BIMA YOJANA(RSBY )	ALL

column1: 6	"Universal health coverage as assured in this new scheme shall exclude the following categories of residents as they can avail healthcare through other schemes.
Residents covered under Employees’ State Insurance Scheme
Residents covered under health assurance or health insurance schemes of their employers
Residents who have taken private health insurance policies on their own
Residents covered under Central Government Health Scheme of the Government of India
Employees of Government of Karnataka till the amendment of the Karnataka Government Servants’ (Medical Attendance) Rules

Members of Karnataka Legislature till the amendment of the Karnataka Legislature (Members Medical Attendance) Rules 1968."		Eligible Patient:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     A patient who is a resident of Karnataka State and belongs to “Eligible Household” as defined under the National Food Security Act
column2: 2013;                                                                                                                                                                                             Eligibility Condition:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     A patient who is a resident of Karnataka State but does not come under the definition of “Eligible Household” as defined under the National Food Security Act
column4: or does not produce the eligible household card. The treatment cost will be on co-payment basis.                      	"  The objective of the scheme is to extend ‘Universal Health Coverage’ to all residents in Karnataka State. Under this new scheme
column6: specified secondary and tertiary health care benefits will be provided.

column1: The current ongoing health schemes like Vajpayee Arogyashree
column2: Yeshaswini Scheme
column3: Rajiv Arogya Bhagya Scheme
column4: RashtriyaSwasthayaBimaYojana (RSBY) including RSBY for senior citizens
column8: Cochlear Implant Scheme etc. will all be converged under this new Arogya Karnataka Scheme."	STATE		AROGYA KARNATAKA	KARNATAKA

Health and Family Welfare Department have enhanced the financial assistance to poor pregnant mothers from Rs. 12000 to Rs. 18000.
2. This scheme is strengthened with Nutrition kit with a view to reducing MMR and IMR.

3. This scheme aims to provide optimal nutrition for pregnant and lactating women and compensates the wage loss during pregnancy.                                                                                                                                                                                                   Eligibility Condition:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     1.  The pregnant mother should have completed 19 yrs of age.
2. The eligible mother will receive all 5 Installments for Two deliveries only.
3. HOB and Migrant mothers will receive 1st and 5th installments on certain conditions                        "	"Procedure to obtain the benefit/Service:
The Pregnant mother should register her pregnancy before 12 weeks with the VHN / UHN or she should have pre – registered her pregnancy before 12 weeks.
Contact Place:VHN/UHN and PHC/UPHC
Beneficiary:Poor pregnant mothers
Benefits:Financial assistance to poor pregnant mothers"	STATE		Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme	TAMIL NADU
